news_header: Two journalists, Konstantin Gabov and Sergey Karelin, describe the harsh conditions of their pre-trial detention in Moscow, where they are accused of supporting an extremist organization linked to Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny.
news_text: Konstantin Gabov and Sergey Karelin, journalists accused of supporting an extremist organization, have detailed their harsh pre-trial detention conditions in Moscow's notorious 'Matrosskaya Tishina' prison. Gabov reports overcrowding, inadequate sleeping arrangements, and poor hygiene, while Karelin describes a lack of privacy and cramped living conditions. Both journalists, along with two others, face charges related to their work with Alexei Navalny's YouTube channel. Their lawyer has called the detention conditions 'torture,' hindering their trial preparations. The trial is ongoing, with the journalists denying the charges.
